instructions.instruction_text: Melt the chocolate in a double boiler (bain-marie): place chocolate in a heatproof bowl over a pot of simmering water, stirring occasionally until completely melted and smooth.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the unsweetened condensed milk, sweetened condensed milk, and egg yolk (separate the white from the yolk).
Add generous amounts of ground cinnamon, lime zest, and vanilla extract to the milk mixture. Whisk well to combine.
Pour the melted chocolate into the milk mixture and beat vigorously until completely homogeneous and smooth.
In a separate clean bowl, whip the egg white until it forms stiff peaks.
Gently fold the whipped egg white into the chocolate mixture using a spatula, being careful not to deflate the whites. Use gentle folding motions.
Pour the mixture into 4 ramekins, filling them about 3/4 full.
Place the ramekins in a large baking dish. Pour hot water into the baking dish until it reaches halfway up the sides of the ramekins (bain-marie method).
Carefully transfer the baking dish to the preheated oven. Bake at 160°C for 25 minutes.
After baking, remove from oven and let cool to room temperature. The flans will have a delicate, creamy texture.
Do not attempt to remove the flans from the ramekins as they are very delicate. Serve directly in the ramekins, chilled or at room temperature.
